content: animal shelter cat blanket by lindsay allercott @hooksyarnsandloopsdesigns materials 5 5 mm hook scrap medium weight #4 yarn tapestry needles stitches used chain - chain st - stitch half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet single_crochet - single_crochet pattern notes i decided to write up this pattern to share with those that were interested in making a few to donate when finished it should measure approximately 15 x 18 i would recommend calling your local shelter to see if this size would work for them it can be easily adjusted by increase or decreasing your starting chain for width and increasing or decreasing the number of row for the length this pattern is great for using up leftover scrap yarn i m sure the cats will love it pattern r1 chain 49 r2 half_double_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and each st across chain 1 turn work 48 st s r3 half_double_crochet in each st across chain 1 turn work 48 st s r4 half_double_crochet in each st across chain 1 turn work 48 st s r5- 43 repeat row 4 or continue until your length reaches about 18 border single_crochet in each st around i did 3 single_crochet in each corner so the corners would lay flat and not lift up tie off cut yarn and weave in your ends if you want to add the paw print to your blanket please have a look at this video https //www youtube com/watch v=6vxxubvshne please tag me in your pictures @hooks yarns and loops designs on facebook or @hooksyarnsandloops on instagram i would love to see the blankets you have made to donate
